datingapp.backend

Class AccountService

  • java.lang.Object
    • datingapp.backend.AccountService

  • public class AccountService
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents the layer between the backend and the database. This class is responsible for all communication between the database and client classes.

    The database stores a table of all users and their information, a table of matches for each user, and a table of compatible users (feed) for each user

    Version:
    05/25/19
    Author:
    Achintya

      • isValid

        public Person isValid(java.lang.String emailAdress,
                      java.lang.String password)
               throws java.sql.SQLException,
                      java.io.IOException,
                      AccountNotFoundException
        backend method used by LoginWindow. Determines whether a login attempt (given email and password) is valid. If it is, the method returns the Person object associated with the given email address
        Parameters:
        emailAdress - given email address
        password - given password
        Returns:
        returns Person object associated with the given email address, or throws an AccountNotFoundException if such a person does not exist.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - in case errors occur when executing a query or processing a result set
        java.io.IOException - in case errors occur when reading a profile picture from the blob
        AccountNotFoundException - in case login attempt is invalid

      • fetchMatches

        public java.util.ArrayList<Person> fetchMatches(Person user)
                                         throws java.sql.SQLException,
                                                java.io.IOException
        fetches a given user's matches stored in the database
        Parameters:
        user - given person
        Returns:
        returns an ArrayList of Person objects representing the user's matches
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - in case of errors with executing queries or processing result sets
        java.io.IOException - in case of errors with fetching users associated with their respective email address (see the fetchUser() method)

      • constructTree

        public Tree constructTree()
                   throws java.sql.SQLException,
                          java.io.IOException
        constructs a tree of datingPools from all the people in the database
        Returns:
        a Tree of ArrayLists of compatible people
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - in case of errors with executing queries or processing result sets
        java.io.IOException - in case of errors with converting database entries to Person objects (see fetchUser() method)
